name: Allah
description: Allah is Al-ism Al-a’zam, the greatest name which contains all the divine attributes and is the sign of the essence and cause of all existence. Allah does not resemble in any way any of His creation. Allah is Allah’s name only. Nothing else can assume this name or share it.

name: Ar-Rahman
description: He is the One who wills Mercy and good for all creation, at all times, He pours upon all creation infinite bounties.

name: Ar-Rahim
description: He is the source of infinite mercy and benificence, who rewards with eternal gifts the one who uses his bounties for the good.

name: Al-Malik
description: He is the owner and ruler of the entire universe, visible and invisible, and of all creation, from before the beginning and after the end.

name: Al-Quddus
description: He is the most pure one, devoid of all Blemish, Shortcoming, Weakness, Heedlessness and Error.

name: As-Salam
description: He is the One who saves the believing servants from all dangers, bringing them peace, blessings and security of paradise.

name: Al-Mu'min
description: He is the illuminator of the light of faith in hearts. He is the Comforter, the Protector of the ones who take refuge in Him.

name: Al-Muhaymin
description: He is the Protector and the Guardian. He is the One who sees to the growth of His creation, leading them where they are destined to go.

name: Al-A'zeez
description: He is the victorious One whom no force can overwhelm. There is no strength in this universe that can stand before His will.

name: Al-Jabbar
description: He is the repairer of the broken, the completer of the lacking, the one who can enforce His will without any opposition.

name: Al-Mutakabbir
description: He is the greatest, who shows His greatness in everything, on all occassions.

name: Al-Khaaliq
description: He is the one who creates from nothing, creating at the same time the states, conditions and sustenance of all that He has created. He establishes how, when and where creation will take place.

name: Al-Baari
description: He is the one who orders His creation with perfect harmony – not only each thing within itself, but everything in accordance with everything else.

name: Al-Musawwir
description: He is the one who, without using any model, shapes everything in the most perfect shape.

name: Al-Ghaffar
description: He is the One who accepts repentance and forgives.

name: Al-Qahhaar
description: He is the ever dominating One, who has surrounded all His creation from without and within with His irresistable power. Nothing can escape Him.

name: Al-Wahhab
description: He is the donor of all, without conditions, without limits without asking anyone benefit or return, giving everything to everyone, everywhere, always.

name: Ar-Razzaaq
description: He is the Sustainer. Sustenance is needed to maintain the creation (both physical and spiritual sustenance).

name: Al-Fattaah
description: He is the Opener & the Solver, the Easer of all that is locked, tied and hardened.

name: Al-Aleem
description: He is the One who knows all. He knows what has happened, what is happening, and what will happen from the beginning to the end.

name: Al-Qaabid
description: He is the One who constricts. All existence is in the power of Allah. The life on this planet is a test for us, but Allah does not test his servants above their ability.

name: Al-Basit
description: He is the one who releases abundance, joy, relief, and ease after difficulties. These are manifestations of His attribute Al-Baasit.

name: Al-Khaafid
description: Allah most high is the One who raises His creatures to honour and fame and who can cast them down to the lowest of the low.

name: Ar-Raafi
description: Allah most high is the One who raises His creatures to honour and fame and who can cast them down to the lowest of the low.

name: Al-Mu'izz
description: He is the One who honours and the One who humiliates.

name: Al-Mudhill
description: He is the One who honours and the One who humiliates.

name: As-Sami
description: He is the one who hears all – that which comes from the lips, passes through the minds, is felt by the hearts, the rustling of leaves in the wind, the footsteps of ants and atoms moving through the void.

name: Al-Baseer
description: He is the One who is all-seeing. He sees all that has passed, all there is, and all there will be until the end of time.

name: Al-Hakam
description: He is the One who orders. He is the bringer of justice and truth. He judges, and executes His justice.

name: Al-`Adl
description: He is the absolute justice. Justice secures peace, balance order and harmony. Allah the just is the enemy of tyrants.

name: Al-Lateef
description: He is the most delicate, fine, gentle, beautiful one, He is the one who knows the finest details of beauty. The finest of His beauties are hidden in the secrets of the beauties of the soul, wisdom, and divine light.

name: Al-Khabeer
description: He is the one who is aware of the hidden inner occurrences in everything. He is the one whose cognisance reaches the deepest, darkest, hidden corners of His kingdom, where neither human intelligence nor His angels can penetrate.

name: Al-Haleem
description: He is forbearing in the punishment of the guilty. He waits, giving time to the sinner to realise his guilt and ask for forgiveness in order that He may forgive him rather than punish him.

name: Al-Azeem
description: He is the greatest on the earth below and in the heavens above, in realms where our sight cannot reach and of which our minds cannot conceive. He is the absolute and perfect greatness.

name: Al-Ghafur
description: He is the most forgiving one. He veils our faults from the eyes of other men, from the angels and relieves us from the suffering of continual remembrance of our faults.

name: Ash-Shakoor
description: He is the one who repays a good deed with a much greater reward. Thankfulness is to return good with good.

name: Al-Ali
description: He is the highest One. He is higher than the whole of the created universe. His nearness and farness and His being high cannot be measured by the limits of human intellect.

name: Al-Kabeer
description: He is the greatest, whose greatness stretches from before the beginning until after the end. There is no difference for Him between the creation of an atom and the infinite –seeming universe. This is His grandeur as much as we can understand it. He is greater than that.

name: Al-Hafeez
description: He is the one who remembers all that was and all that is, keeping in His divine protection all that there will be.

name: Al-Muqit
description: He is the nourisher of all creation. Allah creates the nourishment of His creatures before He creates them. No one can take away the nourishment destined for each element of creation.

name: Al-Haseeb
description: He is the one who takes account of all and everything that His creation does or is subjected to.

name: Al-Jaleel
description: He is the lord of majesty and might. His might and His greatness, His eternity bears no resemblance to any energy, matter or time.

name: Al-Kareem
description: He is the generous One. His greatest generosity is His Mercy, through which He forgives when He could punish.

name: Ar-Raqeeb
description: He is the One who watches everything, always. This scrutiny of every detail in the existence of all creation is in part protective.

name: Al-Mujeeb
description: He is the one who responds to all the needs of His servants. Allah is closer to His creatures than they are to themselves. He is not any closer to a saint than He is to you or a mustard seed.

name: Al-Waasi
description: He is the limitless vastness, whose knowledge, mercy, power, generosity and all other beautiful attributes are infinite.

name: Al-Hakeem
description: He is the perfectly wise, in His knowledge and in His deeds. There is no doubt or uncertainty in His knowledge, nor does it have an end.

name: Al-Wadud
description: He is the one who loves His good servants. He is the only one who is worthy of love.

name: Al-Majeed
description: Allah most high is glorious and majestic in the whole of His creation and beyond. No hand reaches Him, no power can touch Him, yet He is closer to His servants than their own souls. His state is pure perfection. His acts are pure wisdom.

name: Al-Baa'ith
description: He is the raiser from the dead. Allah will give life back to all creation on the day of judgement.

name: Ash-Shaheed
description: He is the one who witnesses all that happens everywhere at all times.

name: Al-Haqq
description: Allah is the truth, whose being is ever unchanged.

name: Al-Wakeel
description: Allah is the ultimate and faithful trustee. Men think that they are able to do, but He is the one who does everything. He can replace everything in the universe, but nothing can replace Him nor can stand on its own without being dependent on Him.

name: Al-Qawi
description: Allah is the most strong one, the inexhaustible. He possesses all strength. He can create a billion universes with the same ease with which He creates a blade of grass.

name: Al-Mateen
description: Allah is perfect in His strength and His firmness. None can be saved from this strength, no force can oppose it and nothing can weaken it.

name: Al-Wali
description: Allah is the protecting friend of His good servants. He eliminates their difficulties and gives them guidance, peace and success in their affairs in this world and in the hereafter.

name: Al-Hameed
description: Allah is most praiseworthy, all that exist praise Allah with their tongues, with their action, or simply by their very existence. He is the only one who is worthy of devotion, respect, thankfulness and praise.

name: Al-Muhsi
description: Allah is the possessor of all quantitative knowledge. He sees and knows everything in its reality. He knows the number of all existence in the universe down to the number of breaths exhaled and inhaled by each of His creatures.

name: Al-Mubdi
description: Allah is the originator of all. He creates without model or material.

name: Al-Mu'eed
description: Allah is the restorer of the things that He has created and destroyed.

name: Al-Muhyi
description: Allah is the giver of life to things without life. Allah is the one who has created life and who has created death, no one else can do that.

name: Al-Mumeet
description: Allah is the creator of death. All who are alive will certainly die. Man is made of a combination of the flesh and the soul. The body is temporal, the soul is eternal.

name: Al-Haiy
description: Allah is the perfectly alive and ever living one. Allah is cognizant of all, and all actions are His. All that is known and will be known is within His knowledge. All existence is always comprehended in His action.

name: Al-Qayyum
description: Allah is the ever self-existing one upon whom the existence of all depends. His existence depends upon none other than Himself.

name: Al-Waajid
description: Allah finds and obtains whatever He wishes whenever He wishes. It is even superfluous to use the word "FIND" because all is in His presence at all times.

name: Al-Maajid
description: Allah is the most glorious, who shows infinite generosity and munificence to those close to Him.

name: Al-Waahid
description: Allah is one. He has no equal, none like Him nor any partner in His essence, in His attributes, in His actions, in His orders, or in His beautiful Names.

name: Al-Ahad
description: He is the unity in which all names, attributes and their relations to any and all are united.

name: As-Samad
description: Allah is the satisfier of all needs, and all is in need of Him. He is the sole recourse; the only place of support where one may go to rid oneself of all trouble and to receive all that one needs through the blessings of this name.

name: Al-Qaadir
description: Allah is the all-powerful who does what He wills the way He wills. He created the universe by Himself, from nothing, with neither materials nor model. He said “be” and it became.

name: Al-Muqtadir
description: Allah is the one who creates all power and has total control over all power. Allah bestows power upon things on earth and in heaven, and uses them in accordance with His all-pervasive wisdom and will.

name: Al-Muqaddim
description: Allah brings forward whomever He wills. Allah advances the chosen among His creation, bringing some above and ahead of others.

name: Al-Mu'akhkhir
description: Allah is He who leaves whomever He wills behind, and delays advancement.

name: Al-Awwal
description: Allah is the first. There is none like Him. His firstness means that there is none prior to Him, that He is self-existent, that all comes from Him and that He is the cause of all that became.

name: Al-Aakhir
description: Allah is the last. As He has no beginning, He has no end. He is eternal. He is the last in the sense that the circle of existence begins and ends with Him.

name: Az-Zaahir
description: Allah is the manifest one. Allah most high is hidden from those who seek to see by means of their senses, but He is apparent to those ho seek to know Him by the wisdom and reason that Allah has bestowed upon them.

name: Al-Baatin
description: Allah is the hidden one. His existence is both manifest and hidden. To truly know the creator is not possible because the knowledge, the mind the understanding of the created one are limited.

name: Al-Waali
description: Allah is the sole manager and governor of the whole creation.

name: Al-Muta'ali
description: Allah is the Supreme One. His greatness grows. As He gives from His inexhaustible treasures, His riches increase. As the needs of His creation increase, His bounties increase.

name: Al-Barr
description: Allah is the perfect doe of good. All good and bounty come from Him. He loves for His servants only good, comfort and ease.

name: At-Tawwaab
description: Allah is He who constantly turns man to repentance.

name: Al-Muntaqim
description: Allah is the great avenger. Allah punishes those who persist in revolting, raving in their unconsciousness and egotism, creating disharmony, tyrannising Allah’s servants and His creation.

name: Al-'Afuww
description: Allah is the forgiver, the eliminator of sins. He does not often punish the ones who deny, the ones who revolt. He accepts their recognition of their sins as repentance. He erases their sins.

name: Ar-Raauf
description: Allah is all clement. In spite of His ability to see our sins, of His being just, of His being able to punish, the fact that He chooses to forgive proves His infinite mercy and clemency.

name: Malik-al-Mulk
description: Allah is the eternal owner of His kingdom. He shares neither the ownership nor the power, government or guardianship of the universe with anyone.

name: Zul-Jalaal-e wal-Ikraam
description: Allah is the Lord of Majesty and bounty. There is no perfection that does not belong to Him nor any blessing or honor that comes from other than Him. Allah is the owner of all majesty.

name: Al-Muqsit
description: Allah is the one who acts and distributes in justice and fairness. How harmonious and balanced is the creation: all the beauties in heaven and earth-mountains, seas, sunsets, flowers – and also the eyes to see.

name: Al-Jaami
description: Allah is the gatherer of whatever He wishes, wherever He wishes. Allah has gathered together within this universe spaces, galaxies-stars, earths, seas, plants and animals, things whose nature, size, shape and colour are different.

name: Al-Ghani
description: Allah is the rich one who is self sufficient. His essence and attributes have no relationship to anything else. Someone whose existence and perfection depend on another needs to earn that existence. Only Allah needs not, neither does He need to earn.

name: Al-Mughni
description: Allah is the enricher. He renders whomever He wishes rich and whomever He wishes poor.

name: Al-Mani
description: Allah is the one who averts harm from His creation.

name: Ad-Daar
description: Allah is the creator of the harmful and evil as He is the creator of the good and beneficial. Ha has also taught us to opt for the good and escape the evil. Ha has given us power of discrimination, given us a will and freedom to choose.

name: An-Naafi
description: Allah is the creator of good. Allah has created man as the best of his creation and He has bestowed upon him gifts which render him unique and superior to the rest of creation.

name: An-Nur
description: Allah is the light that is shed upon the whole creation, making it apparent. That light is the light that brought existence out of the darkness of non-existence.

name: Al-Haadi
description: Allah is the one who creates guidance, leading his servants to good, benficence and the satisfaction of their needs.

name: Al-Badee'u
description: Allah is the Originator of the creation, having created it without model or material. He does not need previous knowledge to think, to first investigate, to figure things out. Everything He creates is a wonder since He originated it from nothing.

name: Al-Baaqi
description: Allah is the everlasting one whose existence in the future is forever. He has neither beginning nor end. The creation will end, and time with it. But Allah the everlasting one will still exist.

name: Al-Waaris
description: Allah is the ultimate inheritor, to whom everything is left after its temporal possessors are gone. It is He who exists after all existence disappears, it is He to whom all existence returns.

name: Ar-Rashid
description: Allah is the righteous teacher who ordains righteousness for all creatures. In His wisdom He leads all matters to their finality in a perfect way and order.

name: As-Sabur
description: Allah is the most patient one. In His creation as in His actions, in His dealings with His creation, nothing is either bigger or smaller, better or worse, earlier or later than is determined for it to be.
